place.name: DODDINGHURST
place.gazetteerText: DODDINGHURST, a parish in Ongar district, Essex; 4¼ miles N by W of Brentwood r. station, and 4½ SE by S of Ongar. Post town, Kelvedon Common, under Brentwood. Acres, 1,892. Real property, £3, 192. Pop., 394. Houses, 81. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £624.* Patron, W. Manbey, Esq. The church is good; and there are charities £15. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
